result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rose L Barfield

records.addlTxt:
2:30 PM Defendant Rose L Barfield in court in custody from DC Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. V. Girard - Clerk 
Court goes over right to have an attorney present
Deft - waives right to counsel for today - was on the waiting list but not qualified- asks for bond to be reduced
State - thinks it should be scheduled with Atty Rivard present due to seriousness of case
Court calls Atty. Rivard - he is now present in court by zoom
Atty Rivard - recd phone call from Samantha - there is a bed open for Ms. Barfield which is available now - did not get notice she did not qualify
State - objects to bond being modified - no changes since in court last time
Court will not modify bond at this time
Atty Rivard argues for lower bond to ensure appearance
Court will not modify it at this time- if going to treatment & bed is available will consider, but if not going or no bed available will not modify bond
Bail/bond hearing on September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Letter from Deft to Judge Mayer
No contact with PMM 12/13/1986. no possession of alcohol. Contact with minor children as permitted by DHS is allowed.
No contact with PMM 12/13/1986, no possession of alcohol.  Contact with minor children as permitted by DHS is allowed.

1:51 PM Defendant Rose L Barfield in court, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Rose L Barfield.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

22CF71, 21CM335, 22CF231, 22CM32

Atty Rivard - deft is restricted from her residence on all bonds, asking to lift that restriction - PMM has now relocated, also asking for modification of bond to be allowed contact with JCE, LMM, DRB per DHS rules in cases 22CF71 & 22CF231, asks for modification of cash bond in 22CF71 to sign bond, asks for modification of cash bond in 22CF231 to sign bond

State - no objection to removal of no contact with residence, Court already allowed communication with children as allowed by CHIPS actions, objects to modification of cash component of bonds

Atty Rivard - makes argument
Court - speaks to deft
Deft - makes statement to the Court
Court - will modify bond if deft has inpatient setup, will not modify cash bond amounts, removes no contact with residence, allows contact with minor children as permitted by DHS
Motion to Modify Bond
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
$2500 sign bond amended to $2500 cash bond
No contact with PMM 12/13/1986, no possession of alcohol, no contact with residence *address confidential*.  Contact with children allowed by CHIPS actions.
